issue.title: Deprecate Python 3.5
issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs
Closes #344 

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.
Removes Python 3.5 as supported language
Updates Travis, setup.py, readme accordingly
A few minor changes to travis.yml just cause of warnings/info from Travis

rename.from: Double check Python 3.8 compliance and if compliant, update docs to reflect that
rename.to: Ensure Python 3.8 compliance, update docs and tests to reflect that

issue.title: No module named 'sklearn.mixture._gaussian_mixture
issue.body:
I am trying to make a conda environment to start playing around with the graspy tutorials and it keeps giving me "No module named 'sklearn.mixture._gaussian_mixture". In an effort to remedy this I uninstalled scikit-learn and reinstalled it with version 0.19.2. But I get a new error in the install saying my python version is too high to be compatible. 

I set up the conda environment using "conda create --name ndd". I then went to install all the dependencies Python 3.8.5, scipy-1.5.0, scikit-learn-0.23.2(and then subsequently  0.19.2.) , networkx-2.5, pandas-1.1.1, numpy-1.19.1. I then installed graspy using the github method as explained on the github page for graspy.

body: Id like to be on this subproject!

How would you want me to demonstrate DoD? As of right now I have jupyter notebooks with the tutorials runnins on python 3.8.5. For the other folders (without tutorials already made) would you recommend I just make some examples which would utilize each part?
Or should I run all the tests(in the repo) in a python 3.8 environment? Hoe would I provide evidence?
All tests need to pass and tutorials need to build in a python 3.8 environment. DoD is that when you add 3.8 as an environment for our automated build process, all checks pass.

labels.name: pkg
labels.description: related to package management, github, travis, etc.

body: Part of doing this is to fix an issue with `rdpg` in `graspy.simulations` not working properly when changed to 3.8. Tests passing means to figure out why the `rdpg` doesn't return expected array.

So should I only be working with trying to get this work with python 3.7? I am a little confused about this workflow atm. Also @j1c I have been able to run all the tests with python 3.8.5 on my machine for the graspy simulations tests (as seen in my prelim PR docs in dfrancisco1998-tests directory). So I think that part is good. I have been getting two errors though, which seem to indicate an issue with file not found in the /tests/match/ tests as well as an error  zero-size array to reduction operation minimum which has no identity for the test_plot.py testing gridplot. I even get an error when I run through the tutorial for plotting with python 3.8.5. I have been trying to fix these two issues this past weekend, but I am running out of ideas.

> So should I only be working with trying to get this work with python 3.7? 

no, I don't follow.

in general, best way to get help is to post on this issue with exactly what errors you are getting (and when, e.g. the details of your environment), exactly what you have tried to get unstuck, and then send that out to the team asking for help.

@bdpedigo  These are the versions of the tools I  am using: 
python                    3.8.5  
scikit-learn              0.23.2                  
scipy                     1.5.0            
seaborn                   0.10.1
pandas                    1.1.1 
numpy                     1.19.1
pytest                    6.0.1                  
pytest-cov                2.10.1                

All these errors were run with the pytest version above as well but typing py.test tests 

While running the files in the tests directory I had gotten two errors. In test_plot.py, there was an issue with the gridplot() which was noticed because the test_gridplot_outputs() failed with "ValueError: zero-size array to reduction operation minimum which has no identity". 
I had tried tracing through the code and working on doing each part separately in a jupyter notebook and there was nothing that was empty(X list had two graphs in it). It may be something with the dataframes, but my tracing has  lead me to believe that is not the case. 
The other error was in /tests/match/ where I got file not found errors for lipa20a and chr12c in the test_barycenter_SGM(self) function. I had tried to access these files in a notebook and it seemed to work. I then tried to change the slashes as well as use an updated path and turn the string into a path object but nothing helped. So I am stuck here as well.

@bdpedigo  and @asaadeldin11 here is the tracebook from the py.test run for second problem :
